items.title: About 40 Killed in Fire at Swiss Resort of Crans-Montana
items.standfirst: Swiss police said about 40 people were killed and 115 injured after a fire broke out in a bar in the ski resort of Crans-Montana during New Year celebrations. Police have cordoned off the area and are investigating the cause. bloom.bg/49k0ycT ---------- Like this video? Subscribe…

items.title: Fire kills dozens at crowded Swiss Alps bar on New Year's
items.standfirst: Police in Switzerland say a fire at a bar in the Crans-Montana ski resort area is believed to have left about 40 people dead and dozens more injured.
items.content: Police in Switzerland say a fire at a bar in the Crans-Montana ski resort area is believed to have left about 40 people dead and dozens more injured.

items.title: Swiss Alps ski resort fire survivors describe terror: "I'm still in shock"
items.standfirst: A night of celebration in the Swiss Alps ended in tragedy after a fire tore through a ski resort bar, killing at least 40 people and injuring dozens more. Ramy Inocencio reports.
items.content: A night of celebration in the Swiss Alps ended in tragedy after a fire tore through a ski resort bar, killing at least 40 people and injuring dozens more. Ramy Inocencio reports.

items.title: Fire at Swiss bar during New Year's celebration kills about 40
items.standfirst: Around 40 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a fire tore through a bar in the Swiss mountain ski town of Crans-Montana. The cause of the fire is still under investigation as the Swiss face a devastating scene. Lisa Desjardins reports.
items.content: Around 40 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a fire tore through a bar in the Swiss mountain ski town of Crans-Montana. The cause of the fire is still under investigation as the Swiss face a devastating scene. Lisa Desjardins reports.

items.title: Around 40 dead in Swiss ski resort bar fire, police say
items.standfirst: A further 115 are injured, some severely, in a fire at Le Constellation bar in Crans-Montana ski resort, officials say.
items.content: A further 115 are injured, some severely, in a fire at Le Constellation bar in Crans-Montana ski resort, officials say.

items.standfirst: Several dozen people are presumed to have died in the fire at a New Year party in the resort of Crans-Montana.
items.content: Several dozen people are presumed to have died in the fire at a New Year party in the resort of Crans-Montana.

items.title: 'Horror movie' ski resort fire leaves dozens dead
items.standfirst: About 40 people were killed and 115 injured in a blaze in at a New Year's Eve Party at an upmarket Swiss ski resort, with the disaster likened to scenes from a horror film.
items.content: About 40 people were killed and 115 injured in a blaze in at a New Year's Eve Party at an upmarket Swiss ski resort, with the disaster likened to scenes from a horror film.

items.title: What to know about the deadly NYE fire in a Swiss resort town
items.standfirst: Swiss authorities are investigating the cause of a devastating fire that ripped through a New Year’s celebration at an Alpine ski resort bar, killing about 40 people and injuring more than 115 in what may rank among the deadliest tragedies in the country's recent history. Switzerland will hold five days of national mourning for the victims.
items.content: Swiss authorities are investigating the cause of a devastating fire that ripped through a New Year’s celebration at an Alpine ski resort bar, killing about 40 people and injuring more than 115 in what may rank among the deadliest tragedies in the country's recent history. Switzerland will hold five days of national mourning for the victims.

items.title: Switzerland resort fire latest news: 40 dead and 115 injured in Crans-Montana – as it happened
items.standfirst: Police have ruled out an attack on Le Constellation bar as investigation starts into cause of fire Officials at the press conference are asking for “prudence” from those in the town, reminding them not to make unnecessary demands on hospitals, which are overwhelmed.Please leave investigators to do their work, they say. Continue reading...
items.content: Police have ruled out an attack on Le Constellation bar as investigation starts into cause of fire Officials at the press conference are asking for “prudence” from those in the town, reminding them not to make unnecessary demands on hospitals, which are overwhelmed.Please leave investigators to do their work, they say. Continue reading...

items.title: Switzerland to hold five days of mourning after 40 killed in resort fire
items.standfirst: Blaze that swept through crowded New Year’s Eve bar in Crans-Montana also injured 115 peopleLe Constellation bar fire in Switzerland: what we know so farSwitzerland will hold five days of mourning after an “unprecedented” fire tore through a crowded bar, killing about 40 people and injuring 115 who were celebrating at a New Year’s Eve party in the Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana.The country’s president, Guy Parmelin, described the blaze as one of the most traumatic events in Switzerland’s history. “It was a drama of an unknown scale,” he said, paying tribute to the many “young lives that were lost and interrupted”. Continue reading...
items.content: Blaze that swept through crowded New Year’s Eve bar in Crans-Montana also injured 115 peopleLe Constellation bar fire in Switzerland: what we know so farSwitzerland will hold five days of mourning after an “unprecedented” fire tore through a crowded bar, killing about 40 people and injuring 115 who were celebrating at a New Year’s Eve party in the Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana.The country’s president, Guy Parmelin, described the blaze as one of the most traumatic events in Switzerland’s history. “It was a drama of an unknown scale,” he said, paying tribute to the many “young lives that were lost and interrupted”. Continue reading...

items.title: About 40 people killed in Swiss Alps resort fire
items.standfirst: About 40 people were killed and more than 100 injured after a fire broke out at a bar at a popular Swiss Alps ski resort town on New Year's Eve, according to police. The president of the Swiss Confederation, Guy Parmelin, said that many of the victims were young people and include Swiss residents as well as tourists from neighboring countries and elsewhere.
items.content: About 40 people were killed and more than 100 injured after a fire broke out at a bar at a popular Swiss Alps ski resort town on New Year's Eve, according to police. The president of the Swiss Confederation, Guy Parmelin, said that many of the victims were young people and include Swiss residents as well as tourists from neighboring countries and elsewhere.

items.title: Latest updates: Dozens killed and around 100 injured in Switzerland
items.standfirst: The fire broke out around 1.30am local time at a bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort. Multiple people are reported to have died and roughly 100 people injured in the overnight blaze. The Italian Foreign Ministry said that 16 Italian nationals are currently missing and 12 are reported injured.
items.content: The fire broke out around 1.30am local time at a bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort. Multiple people are reported to have died and roughly 100 people injured in the overnight blaze. The Italian Foreign Ministry said that 16 Italian nationals are currently missing and 12 are reported injured.

items.title: Disbelief as tragedy hits Swiss ski resort on New Year's Day
items.standfirst: BBC's Silvia Costeloe says the fire happened in the beating heart of lively Crans-Montana.
items.content: BBC's Silvia Costeloe says the fire happened in the beating heart of lively Crans-Montana.

items.title: Switzerland: New Year catastrophe in Swiss ski resort
items.standfirst: Several dozen people are presumed dead and roughly 100 more injured after a fire ripped through a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations in a luxury resort town in southern Switzerland, police said Thursday. The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports.
items.content: Several dozen people are presumed dead and roughly 100 more injured after a fire ripped through a bar during New Year's Eve celebrations in a luxury resort town in southern Switzerland, police said Thursday. The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports.

items.title: Dozens presumed dead after fire rips through Swiss ski resort bar
items.standfirst: Dozens of people are feared dead after a fire swept through a ski resort bar during a New Year’s celebration in Crans-Montana, Switzerland. NBC News’ Daniele Hamamdjian has the details.
items.content: Dozens of people are feared dead after a fire swept through a ski resort bar during a New Year’s celebration in Crans-Montana, Switzerland. NBC News’ Daniele Hamamdjian has the details.

items.title: Switzerland: Dozens killed in fire at Swiss ski resort

The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports the latest.

The cause of the fire remains unknown, but Swiss authorities have said the incident is not being treated as an attack of any kind. France24 correspondent John Zarocostas reports the latest.

items.title: About 40 people are dead and 115 hurt in a fire at Swiss bar's New Year's celebration
items.standfirst: Dozens of people are presumed dead and about 100 injured, most of them seriously, following a fire at a Swiss Alps bar during a New Year's celebration, police said Thursday.
items.content: Dozens of people are presumed dead and about 100 injured, most of them seriously, following a fire at a Swiss Alps bar during a New Year's celebration, police said Thursday.(Image credit: Alessandro della Valle)

items.title: 'Several tens' presumed dead after deadly fire ravages Swiss resort bar's New Year celebration
Deadly fire at Swiss ski resort: Many killed during New Year's celebrations
items.standfirst: A fire at a bar in the upscale Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana just north of the Matterhorn, in Switzerland, has killed dozens of people and injured nearly 100 after breaking out around 1:30 a.m. at the Constellation bar, with investigators now working to determine the cause as authorities say there is no indication the blaze was terror-related. France24 correspondent, John Zarocostas, reports the latest.
items.content: A fire at a bar in the upscale Alpine ski resort of Crans-Montana just north of the Matterhorn, in Switzerland, has killed dozens of people and injured nearly 100 after breaking out around 1:30 a.m. at the Constellation bar, with investigators now working to determine the cause as authorities say there is no indication the blaze was terror-related. France24 correspondent, John Zarocostas, reports the latest.

items.title: Everything we know about deadly Swiss ski resort fire

items.content: A fierce blaze that broke out in a Swiss ski resort during New Year's Eve celebrations has killed about 40 people and injured 115, police said on Thursday afternoon.

items.content: Around 40 people are dead and around 115 others were severely injured after a fire broke out during a New Year’s Eve celebration at a bar in a Swiss Alps resort, authorities said Thursday

items.content: Zohran Mamdani was publicly sworn in and addressed New Yorkers for the first time as the city's 112th mayor.

items.title: Mamdani pledges ‘new era’ for New York and vows to govern ‘audaciously’
items.standfirst: New mayor gives speech at inauguration and rescinds all orders signed by Eric Adams after corruption indictmentZohran Mamdani vowed to “reinvent” New York City in a speech on his first day as mayor, promising “a new era” for America’s largest city and an ambitious start to his term of office.The 34-year-old political star and democratic socialist, who a year ago was a virtually unknown state assemblyman, is the city’s first Muslim mayor, the first of south Asian descent and the first to be born in Africa. He is also the first to be sworn in using the Qur’an. Continue reading...
items.content: New mayor gives speech at inauguration and rescinds all orders signed by Eric Adams after corruption indictmentZohran Mamdani vowed to “reinvent” New York City in a speech on his first day as mayor, promising “a new era” for America’s largest city and an ambitious start to his term of office.The 34-year-old political star and democratic socialist, who a year ago was a virtually unknown state assemblyman, is the city’s first Muslim mayor, the first of south Asian descent and the first to be born in Africa. He is also the first to be sworn in using the Qur’an. Continue reading...

items.title: Zohran Mamdani inaugurated as mayor of New York City

items.content: At a ceremony on the steps of City Hall, Zohran Mamdani has been inaugurated as mayor of New York.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani becomes New York City mayor
items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani became mayor of New York City just after midnight on Thursday, marking a historic moment with a low-key swearing-in ceremony held deep beneath Manhattan. The Democrat, who at 34 is the city’s youngest mayor in generations, takes office as one of the most closely watched political figures in the United States. Ellen Gainsford reports.
items.content: Zohran Mamdani became mayor of New York City just after midnight on Thursday, marking a historic moment with a low-key swearing-in ceremony held deep beneath Manhattan. The Democrat, who at 34 is the city’s youngest mayor in generations, takes office as one of the most closely watched political figures in the United States. Ellen Gainsford reports.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in, becoming NYC's 112th mayor
items.standfirst: In a private ceremony at the abandoned Old City Hall subway station​, Mamdani was sworn in by New York Attorney General Letitia James as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve.
items.content: In a private ceremony at the abandoned Old City Hall subway station​, Mamdani was sworn in by New York Attorney General Letitia James as the clock struck midnight on New Year's Eve.

items.title: Two people confirmed dead as Iran protests turn into ‘battlefield’
items.standfirst: Nationwide protests against living conditions enter fifth day with security forces reportedly using live ammunitionThe largest protests in Iran for three years entered a fifth day on Thursday amid reports of deadly clashes between protesters and security forces, with state-affiliated media confirming at least two people had been killed.Although state media did not identify those killed, witnesses and videos circulating on social media appear to show protesters lying motionless on the ground after security forces opened fire. Continue reading...
items.content: Nationwide protests against living conditions enter fifth day with security forces reportedly using live ammunitionThe largest protests in Iran for three years entered a fifth day on Thursday amid reports of deadly clashes between protesters and security forces, with state-affiliated media confirming at least two people had been killed.Although state media did not identify those killed, witnesses and videos circulating on social media appear to show protesters lying motionless on the ground after security forces opened fire. Continue reading...

items.content: The largest protests in Iran in three years reached a deadly climax overnight into Thursday, with several people killed, Iranian media and a rights group have reported.

items.title: Iran protests turn deadly: Government has offered dialogue in face of demonstrations
items.standfirst: A member of Iran’s security forces was killed, marking the first reported death after several days of demonstrations over soaring inflation, in what has been the most significant unrest in the country since nationwide protests three years ago. Adjunct Senior Lecturer at Lund University, Rouzbeh Parsi, shares his insights.
items.content: A member of Iran’s security forces was killed, marking the first reported death after several days of demonstrations over soaring inflation, in what has been the most significant unrest in the country since nationwide protests three years ago. clusters.title: Price hikes hit ACA health insurance plans as subsidies expire
clusters.neutral_headline: Price hikes hit ACA health insurance plans as subsidies expire

items.title: Price hikes hit ACA health insurance plans as subsidies expire
items.standfirst: Enhanced tax credits that have helped Americans offset the cost of Affordable Care Act health insurance for the last four years expired overnight.
items.content: Enhanced tax credits that have helped Americans offset the cost of Affordable Care Act health insurance for the last four years expired overnight.

items.title: Millions facing health care cost increases as tax credits lapse
items.standfirst: Enhanced tax credits that have helped reduce the cost of health insurance for the vast majority of Affordable Care Act enrollees expired overnight as 2026 arrived, cementing higher health costs for millions of Americans at the start of the new year. Nicole Sganga reports.
items.content: Enhanced tax credits that have helped reduce the cost of health insurance for the vast majority of Affordable Care Act enrollees expired overnight as 2026 arrived, cementing higher health costs for millions of Americans at the start of the new year. Nicole Sganga reports.

items.title: US health insurance costs to rise by 114% for millions as subsidies expire
items.standfirst: More than 20 million people in the United States will face sharply higher health insurance costs as of January 1 after enhanced tax credits that helped enrollees in the Affordable Care Act afford coverage expired overnight. The expiration of the subsidies will mostly affect families, small business owners and self-employed workers.
items.content: More than 20 million people in the United States will face sharply higher health insurance costs as of January 1 after enhanced tax credits that helped enrollees in the Affordable Care Act afford coverage expired overnight. The expiration of the subsidies will mostly affect families, small business owners and self-employed workers.

items.title: Flash floods kill at least 17 people in Afghanistan

items.content: Afghanistan's disaster management agency says the season's first heavy rain and snowfall has ended a prolonged dry spell but triggered flash floods, killing at least 17 people and injuring 11 others.

items.title: Trump says he takes more aspirin than recommended but his ‘health is perfect’
items.standfirst: President tells Wall Street Journal in interview that his doctors encouraged him to take lower dose but he declinedDonald Trump takes “more aspirin” than his doctors recommend but says his “health is perfect”, according to an interview given to the Wall Street Journal after the outlet recently questioned the 79-year-old president’s health.Trump told the Journal that the large dose of aspirin he take daily causes him to bruise easily and that doctors have encouraged him to take a lower dose – but he declined the advice because he has been taking it for 25 years. Continue reading...
items.content: President tells Wall Street Journal in interview that his doctors encouraged him to take lower dose but he declinedDonald Trump takes “more aspirin” than his doctors recommend but says his “health is perfect”, according to an interview given to the Wall Street Journal after the outlet recently questioned the 79-year-old president’s health.Trump told the Journal that the large dose of aspirin he take daily causes him to bruise easily and that doctors have encouraged him to take a lower dose – but he declined the advice because he has been taking it for 25 years. Continue reading...

items.title: Bolsonaro leaves hospital and returns to prison after being denied house arrest

items.content: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been discharged from hospital in Brasília and taken back into custody, a week after undergoing double hernia surgery, as he continues to serve a prison sentence for leading an attempted coup.

items.title: Putin voices confidence in war victory
items.standfirst: Meanwhile, Russia says it will provide Washington with evidence that a Ukrainian drone targeted one of Vladimir Putin’s residences before being shot down on Monday, a claim Ukraine firmly denies. France24 International affairs editor Angela Diffley explains.
items.content: Meanwhile, Russia says it will provide Washington with evidence that a Ukrainian drone targeted one of Vladimir Putin’s residences before being shot down on Monday, a claim Ukraine firmly denies. France24 International affairs editor Angela Diffley explains.

items.title: Kyiv argues alleged attack on Putin’s home was Russian false-flag operation
items.standfirst: The CIA has concluded that Ukraine did not attempt to target Russian President Vladimir Putin or any of his residences in an attack earlier this week, an allegation Kyiv has firmly denied, saying the Kremlin is using the claim to harden its stance in peace negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine. France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert shares his insights.
items.content: The CIA has concluded that Ukraine did not attempt to target Russian President Vladimir Putin or any of his residences in an attack earlier this week, an allegation Kyiv has firmly denied, saying the Kremlin is using the claim to harden its stance in peace negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine. France24 International Affairs commentator Douglas Herbert shares his insights.

items.title: U.S. finds Ukraine did not try to kill Putin in alleged drone strike, source says

items.content: A CIA assessment has concluded that Ukraine did not try to kill Russian President Vladimir Putin at his country residence as alleged by the Kremlin, a source with knowledge of the matter told NBC News
